article.headline: Here's everything coming to Netflix in August 2020 - and what's leaving
article.body: August is typically a slow month for TV series and a dumping ground for movies, and Netflix Inc. doesn't seem to be immune from that trend. While Netflix NFLX, +1.43%  still has dozens of original series, specials and movies on tap for August 2020, barely a handful have mass appeal. The most promising of the bunch are Season 5 of "Lucifer" (Aug. 21), the cult favorite that Netflix rescued from Fox about a bored devil who works with the LAPD as a side hustle; "Hoops" (Aug. 21), an animated comedy about a foul-mouthed high school basketball coach, with voice work from Jake Johnson and Ron Funches; and "Project Power," (Aug. 14), a blockbuster-ish action movie about a pill that gives people superpowers for 5 minutes at a time, starring Jamie Foxx and Joseph Gordon-Levitt. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Other notable additions include new seasons of international series such as Denmark's post-apocalyptic drama "Rain" (Aug. 6), Spain's period drama "High Seas" (Aug. 7), and Brazil's dystopian thriller "3%" (Aug. 14); the new documentary series "Immigration Nation" (Aug. 3); and a new season of the real-estate reality show "Selling Sunset" (Aug. 7). Update: The Trump administration has reportedly tried to block the release of "Immigration Nation," which shows some ICE agents in an unfavorable light - which just might make it must-see TV. Also: What's coming in August to Amazon Prime Video | Hulu | HBO Max And more:Here's what's worth streaming in August 2020: 'Lovecraft Country,' 'Immigration Nation' and more One quirky programming note: Netflix is adding both seasons of YouTube Red's "Karate Kid" spinoff "Cobra Kai" (Aug. 28), but losing the first three "Karate Kid" movies on Aug. 31.
